Based on the user's preference cues, I would recommend "The Life Before Her Eyes".
This movie follows a woman who is convicted of murder and sentenced to death in prison.
But before she dies, she receives visits from other prisoners, including some who have been diagnosed with terminal illnesses themselves.
Through these conversations, she starts to understand her own situation more clearly.
And eventually, she realizes that the only way to truly live your life fully is to embrace the uncertainty and take risks.

The movie has a strong emotional impact and it's definitely worth watching.

I would highly recommend "Amen" to someone who enjoys thought-provoking films. The movie follows a young man as he begins to see his father's ghost.
